python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.cspline_fitter module

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.cspline_fitter.cspline_fitter(parameters, preview=False)[source]

Cspline fitter. Reference: https://github.com/jries/fit3Dcspline/blob/master/simplefitter_cspline.m

Parameters:

  • parameters (dict) – dictionary from parameters (SMAP output file)

  • preview (bool) – don’t use

Returns:

None

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.cspline_fitter_dask module

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.cspline_fitter_dask.cspline_fitter_dask(parameters)[source]

This function reads the stack in lazy mode via Dask. It detects PSFs, extracts ROIs, performs spline fit and saves the results Args: parameters : dict, parameters required for spline fitting.

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.difference_of_gaussians module

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.difference_of_gaussians.difference_of_gaussians(imphot, peakfilter)[source]

This function computes differences of gaussian (DoG) of an image. Traduction of https://github.com/jries/SMAP/blob/master/fit3Dcspline/simplefitter_cspline.m :param imphot: array, one image of the stack :param peakfilter: float, peak value to use

Returns:

array, processed image

Return type:

impf

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.filter2 module

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.filter2.filter2(b, x, shape='same')[source]

Two-dimensional digital filter. Adapted from :param b: ndarray, the 2-D FIR filter :param x: ndarray, input data to filter. :param shape: {‘same’, ‘valid’, ‘full’}, optional

Returns:

ndarray, filtered data.

Return type:

y

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.fitspline module

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.fitspline.fit_spline(imstack, peakcoordinates, parameters, varstack)[source]

Perform the spline fitting of ROIs in imstack. :param imstack: stack of images (ROIs) :type imstack: np.ndarray :param peakcoordinates: coordinates of the detected PSFs :type peakcoordinates: np.ndarray :param parameters: parameters dictionary :type parameters: dict :param varstack: variance map if sCMOS camera. Else, 0 or None. :type varstack: np.ndarray

Returns:

np.ndarray, results of the spline fitting

Return type:

results

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.fspecial.gaussian_filter(HSIZE, SIGMA)[source]

This function creates a gaussian kernel. :param HSIZE: int, size of kernel :param SIGMA: float, sigma to generate the kernel

Returns:

array, gaussian kernel

Return type:

k2d

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.maximumfindcall module

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.maximumfindcall.maximumfindcall(imin)[source]

This function finds local maxima in a 2D image using similar approch to Neubeck&Gool algorithm. Adapted from https://github.com/jries/fit3Dcspline/blob/master/shared/maximumfindcall.m :param imin: np.array, input image

Returns:

array, contains [x,y, intensity] for each maxima

Return type:

maximaout

Structure to define a 3D dimension for CUDA kernel launch. Uses for kernel launch by setting DimBlock and DimGrid.

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.mleFit.mleFit_LM(imstack, iterations, fitpar, varmap, zstart)[source]

MLE fit using GPU adapted from https://github.com/jries/SMAP/blob/master/fit3Dcspline/source/GPUmleFit_LM_SingleChannel/GPUmleFit_LM/mexFunction.cpp :param imstack: 3D image stack :type imstack: np.ndarray :param iterations: number of iterations :type iterations: int :param fitpar: parameters :type fitpar: np.ndarray :param varmap: variance map if sCMOS, else not used :type varmap: np.ndarray :param zstart: starting z (depth) value :type zstart: float

Returns:

parameters CRLBs_host (np.ndarray): CRLBs LogLike_host (np.ndarray): Log likelihood

Return type:

Parameters_host (np.ndarray)

DLL compilation in Admin VISUAL STUDIO terminal: nvcc -ccbin “C:/Program Files/Microsoft Visual Studio/2022/Community/VC/Tools/MSVC/14.29.30133/bin/Hostx64/x64” -shared -o GPUmleFit.dll wrapper.cu GPUmleFit_LM_EMCCD.cu GPUmleFit_LM_sCMOS.cu -Xcompiler “/MD” -Xlinker “/NODEFAULTLIB:LIBCMT” Requires Visual Studio 22 installed

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.preview_splinefitter module

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.preview_splinefitter.previews_splinefitter(parameters, number_frames=1)[source]

Preview function. From parameters, detect ROIs and show in live a red for on top of each detected spots. :param parameters: dictionary from parameters (SMAP output file) :type parameters: dict :param number_frames: int, number of frames to use for preview

Returns:

stock_imphot: stock_maxgood:

Return type:

img

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.save_as_locpalmtracer.from_plane_to_index(planes)[source]

This function generates index list from list of plane :param Planes: array of int

Returns:

list of int

Return type:

transformed_list

eg: [1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 2, 3, 3, 4, 4, 4, 5, 5] Out [1, 2, 3, 4, 1, 2, 3, 1, 2, 1, 2, 3, 1, 2]

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.save_as_locpalmtracer.save_as_locpalmtracer(image_size, results, parameters, outputfile_name='results.txt')[source]

This function initializes and fills two dict() compatible with PALMTracer file format :param image_size: return of np.shape, (z, y, x) format :param results: int, number of planes (image_size[0]) :param parameters: dict(), contains parameters used for spline fitting :param outputfile_name: not used

Returns:

None

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.save_results_python module

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.save_results_python.save_results_python(results, p, output_filename='results.csv')[source]

Save the results of the spline fitter in a CSV/txt file. :param results: results from the spline fitter :type results: np.ndarray :param p: parameters from the spline fitter :type p: dict :param output_filename: output filename :type output_filename: str

Returns:

None

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.set_parameters module

python_tracer.SplineFitterSMAP.set_parameters.set_parameters(stack_path, calib_file, offset=None, conversion=0.12, peakfilter=1.2, peakcutoff=15, roifit=13, outputfile='./outputSMAP.csv', pixelsize=160)[source]

Set the parameters for the spline fitter. Some parameters are irrelevant for the spline fitter (raw translation of Matlab code).

Parameters:

  • stack_path – path to the stack file

  • calib_file – path to the calibration file

  • offset – offset value

  • conversion – conversion value EM

  • peakfilter – peak filter size of gaussian filter

  • peakcutoff – peak cutoff value

  • roifit – ROI size around the peak

  • outputfile – output file path (need to be removed)

  • pixelsize – pixel size in nm

Returns:

dictionary containing the parameters.

Return type:

parameters
